name: Donald J. Trump
bio: Donald J. Trump is the 47th President of the United States, inaugurated for a second term in 2025. A businessman and former television personality, he previously served as the 45th President from 2017 to 2021. His administration focuses on economic nationalism, border security, and executive authority.
education: University of Pennsylvania (BS in Economics, Wharton School)
endorsements: Turning Point USA, National Rifle Association, Heritage Action
platform: Border security, economic revival, energy dominance, and America First foreign policy.

platformFollowThrough.Border Security: Reinstated border wall construction and expanded deportation authority via executive action.
platformFollowThrough.Economic Revival: Pushed for tax cuts, deregulation, and reshoring of manufacturing jobs.
platformFollowThrough.Energy Dominance: Approved new drilling leases and reversed climate-related restrictions.
platformFollowThrough.America First: Withdrew from multilateral agreements and reprioritized bilateral trade deals.

proposals: Impose tariffs on foreign automakers, dismantle DEI mandates in federal agencies, and expand school choice nationwide.

name: JD Vance
bio: JD Vance is the 50th Vice President of the United States, inaugurated in 2025. A former U.S. Senator from Ohio and author of 'Hillbilly Elegy,' Vance is known for his populist conservatism and focus on working-class issues. He served in the U.S. Marine Corps and holds a law degree from Yale.
education: Ohio State University (BA), Yale Law School (JD)
endorsements: Heritage Foundation, Club for Growth, American Principles Project
platform: Working-class revival, tech regulation, border enforcement, and cultural conservatism.

platformFollowThrough.Working-Class Revival: Advocated for trade reform and domestic manufacturing incentives.
platformFollowThrough.Tech Regulation: Supports antitrust action against Big Tech and online censorship reform.
platformFollowThrough.Border Enforcement: Backed Trump-era immigration policies and Title 42 reinstatement.
platformFollowThrough.Cultural Conservatism: Opposes federal funding for DEI programs and gender ideology in schools.

proposals: Break up tech monopolies, expand vocational training, and restrict foreign land ownership.
